results.title: A Word to the wise
results.brief_description: Carelessness with an electric iron, a cigarette, or a radiator can start a fire in your home, or in your next door neighbour’s home. This film demonstrates how to take precautions against such common domestic fire hazards and provides statistical information on just how easily fires can start. Entertaining and informative narration.

results.title: A Wonderful construction
results.brief_description: Discusses the lack of job satisfaction on construction sites in America since the depression. Through commentary and interview, compares this with the ideal city as envisaged by the French artist, Fernand Leger in his painting “Les Constructeurs”. Written and photographed by Don Lenzer. Music by Erik Satie and Frank Zappa.

results.title: A Woman's story
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: Through the story of one woman, the film gives an account of the work done by thousands of women in Britain who devote part of their spare time to various voluntary social services. The film is also significant in its exploration of the precursor of what would become the Department of Family and Community Services, staffed not by philanthropic local volunteers but by professional social workers.

results.title: A Woman's place ... is on the school council
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Warren Thomas
results.brief_description: A program designed to encourage women to become members of their school council. Emphasises the need for effective communication and how to overcome barriers to communication.

results.title: A Wife among wives: notes on Turkana marriage
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Turkana Conversations No. 2”.
This film examines how an African tribe, the Turkana, views marriage. Conversations amongst the community, particularly the women, are recorded and reveal a complex social structure.

results.title: A Whaling voyage
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center Film Studio and John Friedman
results.brief_description: Shows the preparation and the voyage of a whaling ship working under sail, killing and rendering a large whale. Contains an excerpt from a 1922 feature - Elmer Clifton’s “Down to the sea in ships”.

results.title: A Wet tale (K)
results.brief_description: An animated adventure featuring a small droplet of water. The story is an amusing one and it is also educational, giving very young viewers their first glimpse of the recycling of water on earth.

results.title: A Way of caring
results.brief_description: A record of a typical day in the lives of a group of seventeen severely mentally handicapped children who live in a small hostel on the outskirts of a large provincial town. Shows how the individual attention of the six housemothers and the home atmosphere of the hostel, is reflected in the children’s behaviour.

results.title: A Watch on the southern sky
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Provides a brief history of astronomy and a look at constellations. The program then focuses on how to map the sky and determine the location of celestial objects as well as looking at the differences between stars in terms of magnitude, colour and position. Examines the Moon and its cycles, and the location of planets in the night sky.
